intro: Malcolmia aegyptiaca subsp. longisiliqua, commonly known as Egyptian malva, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance contribute to its use in horticulture and ecological restoration projects.
